episodes.description: Psychic visions draw Eleven to a band of violent outcasts and an angry girl with a shadowy past.

episodes.name: Chapter Eight: The Mind Flayer
episodes.description: An unlikely hero steps forward when a deadly development puts the Hawkins lab on lockdown, trapping Will and several others inside.

episodes.name: Chapter Nine: The Gate
episodes.description: Eleven makes plans to finish what she started while the survivors turn up the heat on the monstrous force that's holding Will hostage.

episodes.name: Chapter One: Suzie, Do You Copy?
episodes.description: Summer brings new jobs and budding romance. But the mood shifts when Dustin's radio picks up a Russian broadcast, and Will senses something is wrong.

episodes.name: Chapter Two: The Mall Rats
episodes.description: Nancy and Jonathan follow a lead, Steve and Robin sign on to a secret mission, and Max and Eleven go shopping. A rattled Billy has troubling visions.

episodes.name: Chapter Three: The Case of the Missing Lifeguard
episodes.description: With El and Max looking for Billy, Will declares a day without girls. Steve and Dustin go on a stakeout, and Joyce and Hopper return to Hawkins Lab.

episodes.name: Chapter Four: The Sauna Test
episodes.description: A code red brings the gang back together to face a frighteningly familiar evil. Karen urges Nancy to keep digging, and Robin finds a useful map.

episodes.name: Chapter Five: The Flayed
episodes.description: Strange surprises lurk inside an old farmhouse and deep beneath the Starcourt Mall. Meanwhile, the Mind Flayer is gathering strength.

episodes.name: Chapter Six: E Pluribus Unum
episodes.description: Dr. Alexei reveals what the Russians have been building, and Eleven sees where Billy has been. Dustin and Erica stage a daring rescue.

episodes.name: Chapter Seven: The Bite
episodes.description: With time running out - and an assassin close behind - Hopper's crew races back to Hawkins, where El and the kids are preparing for war.

episodes.name: Chapter Eight: The Battle of Starcourt
episodes.description: Terror reigns in the food court when the Mind Flayer comes to collect. But down below, in the dark, the future of the world is at stake.

episodes.name: Chapter One: The Hellfire Club
episodes.description: Still reeling from the events last year, the gang tries to move on with their lives. However, a threat is brewing both on Earth and the Upside Down.

episodes.name: Chapter Two: Vecna's Curse
episodes.description: A plane brings Mike to California -- and a dead body brings Hawkins to a halt. Nancy goes looking for leads. A shaken Eddie tells the gang what he saw.

episodes.name: Chapter Three: The Monster and the Superhero
episodes.description: Murray and Joyce fly to Alaska, and El faces serious consequences. Robin and Nancy dig up dirt on Hawkins' demons. Dr. Owens delivers sobering news.

episodes.name: Chapter Four: Dear Billy
episodes.description: Max is in grave danger - and running out of time. A patient at Pennhurst Asylum has visitors. Elsewhere, in Russia, Hopper is hard at work.

episodes.name: Chapter Five: The Nina Project
episodes.description: Owens takes El to Nevada, where she's forced to confront her past, while the Hawkins kids comb a crumbling house for clues. Vecna claims another victim.

episodes.name: Chapter Six: The Dive
episodes.description: Behind the Iron Curtain, a risky rescue mission gets underway. The California crew seeks help from a hacker. Steve takes one for the team.

episodes.name: Chapter Seven: The Massacre at Hawkins Lab
episodes.description: As Hopper braces to battle a monster, Dustin dissects Vecna's motives -- and decodes a message from beyond. El finds strength in a distant memory.

episodes.name: Chapter Eight: Papa
episodes.description: Nancy has sobering visions, and El passes an important test. Back in Hawkins, the gang gathers supplies and prepares for battle.

episodes.name: Chapter Nine: The Piggyback
episodes.description: With selfless hearts and a clash of metal, heroes fight from every corner of the battlefield to save Hawkins - and the world itself.

name: From
description: Unravel the mystery of a city in middle U.S.A. that imprisons everyone who enters. As the residents struggle to maintain a sense of normality and seek a way out, they must also survive the threats of the surrounding forest.

episodes.name: Long Day's Journey Into Night
episodes.description: The Matthews' family road trip takes a horrifying turn when they are detoured to a small town from which they cannot leave. When their family RV crashes, Sheriff Boyd Stevens and other residents rush to save them before the sun goes down.

episodes.name: The Way Things Are Now
episodes.description: At Colony House, Tabitha and Julie grapple with their new nightmarish reality. Out in the forest, Jim, Boyd and Kristi struggle to treat Ethan's injuries. Tragedy strikes from an unexpected source as a new threat arises.

episodes.name: Choosing Day
episodes.description: The Matthews family must choose which of the two settlements they will join. Meanwhile, Jade comes to terms with his situation and Boyd is faced with an impossible decision that strikes at the very heart of life in the town.

episodes.name: A Rock and a Farway
episodes.description: Julie and Ethan make new friends, their parents discuss their differences, and Boyd and Khatri talk about Boyd's role in the community.

episodes.name: Silhouettes
episodes.description: Jim, Tabitha, and Ethan begin asking questions about where they are in the hopes it may lead them home. Ellis and Fatima show Julie the lighter side of life in town. Jade struggles to make sense of their situation as Boyd seeks guidance.

episodes.name: Book 74
episodes.description: Boyd's plan to head off into the forest provokes an unexpected response from Kenny. Jade enlists Jim's help with an experiment while Tabitha makes a chilling discovery that sends her down a unique path searching for answers.

episodes.name: All Good Things...
episodes.description: A celebration at Colony House turns into tragedy. Khatri tries to convince Boyd to take him and Sarah with him.

episodes.name: Broken Windows, Open Doors
episodes.description: In the wake of another death, Boyd questions his decision to leave; Kenny steps up and embraces his new role; Jim rallies the town around his idea to build a radio tower

episodes.name: Into the Woods
episodes.description: Boyd takes Sara into the forest to find a way home, and they uncover more mysteries. Some of the townfolk wonder if they want to go home.

episodes.name: Oh, the Places We'll Go
episodes.description: Jim's radio tower yields consequences which rock him to his very core. The hole that Tabitha has been digging leads her somewhere - and to someone - she could never have expected. Everything is about to change.

episodes.name: Strangers in a Strange Land
episodes.description: In Sheriff Boyd's absence, Donna and Kenny struggle to manage the chaos as a busload of unwitting newcomers arrives in town; Victor and Tabitha go on a chilling journey through the nightmarish labyrinth of tunnels beneath the town.

episodes.name: The Kindness of Strangers
episodes.description: A tense night in the diner as the residents and newcomers wait for sunrise; fear permeates the wreckage beneath the Matthews house, as Jim and Tom struggle to keep a panicked bus passenger quiet.

episodes.name: Tether
episodes.description: Kenny and Ellis make a grisly discovery out in the forest; Boyd struggles with the reality of what's happening to him.

episodes.name: This Way Gone
episodes.description: As Boyd's condition grows more alarming, Sara's return to town puts him in a difficult position; Jim shares a troubling new theory about the town.

episodes.name: Lullaby
episodes.description: Sara must face the music, as word of her return spreads through town; Victor and Jade strike an unlikely bargain.

episodes.name: Pas de Deux
episodes.description: Tensions run high at Colony House when word of the coming food shortage leaks out; a night at the clinic takes a terrifying turn.

episodes.name: Belly of the Beast
episodes.description: Boyd and Kristi seek to capitalize on a new discovery; Jim finds an unlikely ally in the volatile Randall.

episodes.name: Forest for the Trees
episodes.description: In their pursuit of the truth about the town, Jim and Randall hatch a dangerous plan; meanwhile, a new form of terror is brewing.

episodes.name: Ball of Magic Fire
episodes.description: Panic spreads through town as the residents face a chilling new threat to their survival; Jim realizes the magnitude of the mistake he made by enlisting Randall in his cause.

episodes.name: Once Upon a Time...
episodes.description: Boyd fears he may have finally run out of answers, as the residents of town prepare for the end; Tabitha clings to the belief that the children could be the key to their salvation.

episodes.name: Shatter
episodes.description: Boyd feels the town slipping away from him as the weather grows colder and the residents more desperate.

episodes.name: When We Go
episodes.description: Boyd struggles to find a path forward as the town says farewell to one of their own. Fatima's health takes a turn for the worse, while Tabitha finds help from an unlikely ally.

episodes.name: Mouse Trap
episodes.description: Kenny leads a group into the forest in search of food as Donna and Ellis try to talk Boyd out of a dangerous plan. Meanwhile, Tabitha makes a mind-bending discovery.

episodes.name: There and Back Again
episodes.description: Boyd is forced to make a tough decision when newcomers arrive in town at nightfall; Victor unearths memories from the past in the hopes of finding answers.

episodes.name: The Light of Day
episodes.description: Victor must face a painful reminder of his past; Julie looks for ways to cope with her trauma; Boyd struggles to keep the town safe as the residents begin to question his judgment; Tabitha tries to adjust to her new surroundings.

episodes.name: Scar Tissue
episodes.description: Fatima and Ellis make a big decision about her pregnancy; Boyd fears for the future of his family; Tensions rise in the Matthews house; Randall opens up to Marielle about his fears.

episodes.name: These Fragile Lives
episodes.description: The edges begin to fray as concerns about Fatima's pregnancy deepen; Jade follows a clue trail into the forest; Julie and Randall seek a bit of normalcy.

episodes.name: Thresholds
episodes.description: Accusations start flying and truths come to light in the aftermath of a tragedy; Victor struggles to recover long-buried memories about the town's past; Julie and Ethan search for answers about the mysterious ruins in the woods.

episodes.name: Revelations: Chapter One
episodes.description: Tensions are at an all-time high as the town residents learn that one of their own has gone missing.

episodes.name: Revelations: Chapter Two
episodes.description: Boyd is pushed to his limit as time begins to run out for someone he loves; Randall is haunted by his trauma and Victor reveals a hard truth; Tabitha's unlikely journey takes a shocking turn.

name: Lost
description: The survivors of a plane crash are forced to work together in order to survive on a seemingly deserted tropical island.

episodes.name: Pilot: Part 1
episodes.description: Forty-eight survivors of an airline flight originating from Australia, bound for the U.S., which crash-lands onto an unknown island 1000 miles off course, struggle to figure out a way to survive while trying to find a way to be rescued.

episodes.name: Pilot: Part 2
episodes.description: Having retrieved the plane tranceiver, a group of survivors try to transmit a signal, only to receive a strange transmission from another inhabitant.

episodes.name: Tabula Rasa
episodes.description: Jack and Hurley discover an alarming secret about Kate, while the marshal's life hangs in the balance.

episodes.name: Walkabout
episodes.description: When the survivors run out of food, Locke, Kate, and Michael go out hunting for boar. Michael gets injured, so he and Kate go back. But Locke stays out hunting, and ends up running into the creature living in the jungle.

episodes.name: White Rabbit
episodes.description: Jack begins to experience visions of his father. Things go wrong when he runs into the jungle after him. Claire has difficulties with her pregnancy.

episodes.name: House of the Rising Sun
episodes.description: Jin attacks Michael for seemingly no reason; Jack wants to move the survivors over to the caves, although some people disagree.

episodes.name: The Moth
episodes.description: Charlie begins a journey of withdrawal from drugs aided by Locke, whose true motive is a mystery. Jack is buried alive in a cave collapse.

episodes.name: Confidence Man
episodes.description: Shannon is having an asthma attack and Boone is sure that Sawyer has her medication. As Kate's way of dealing with this situation doesn't work, Sayid takes things into his own hands.

episodes.name: Solitary
episodes.description: Sayid's life is in danger after finding the source of the French transmission, while Hurley hatches a ridiculous plan to make life more civilized.

episodes.name: Raised by Another
episodes.description: Claire has a horribly realistic nightmare about her baby being harmed, while flashbacks reveal her troubled past.

episodes.name: All the Best Cowboys Have Daddy Issues
episodes.description: Jack, Kate, Locke and Boone go after Ethan, Claire and Charlie. They separate, and while Jack and Kate confront Ethan, Locke and Boon find another mystery at the jungle. Flashbacks reveal more about Jack's past with his dad.

episodes.name: Whatever the Case May Be
episodes.description: Kate and Sawyer discover a briefcase and the race begins to win ownership of it. Charlie is still depressed over Claire, and is given a sharp talking to by Rose.

episodes.name: Hearts and Minds
episodes.description: Locke plans to teach Boone a lesson, when he learns that Boone wants to share their secret with Shannon.

episodes.name: Special
episodes.description: A mysterious island beast reappears when Michael and Locke clash. Sayid enlists Shannon to help decipher the French woman's map.

episodes.name: Homecoming
episodes.description: After Claire returns with no memory since the flight, Jack and Locke form a plan against her kidnapper, who threatens to kill the other survivors.

episodes.name: Outlaws
episodes.description: Sawyer believes that a boar is harassing him. So he and Kate go to find it. They bond on the journey. They run into Locke, who tells them a story that seems to mean something to Sawyer.

episodes.name: ...In Translation
episodes.description: When the raft the survivors have been building burns down, Michael accuses Jin of sabotage. Sun makes a surprising revelation.

episodes.name: Numbers
episodes.description: When Hurley becomes obsessed with the French woman and heads into the jungle to find her, Jack, Sayid and Charlie have no choice but to follow. Meanwhile, Locke asks Claire to help build a mysterious item.

episodes.name: Deus Ex Machina
episodes.description: Locke thinks he knows how to get the hatch open, and he and Boone venture inland. Jack is reluctant to help Sawyer get glasses.

episodes.name: Do No Harm
episodes.description: Claire goes into labor while a helpless Charlie goes into panic mode. Meanwhile Locke is missing, Jack tends to a wounded Boone and Sayid presents Shannon with a romantic surprise.

episodes.name: The Greater Good
episodes.description: After burying one of their own, tempers flare as the castaways' suspicions of each other grow -- and an unlikely survivor vows revenge. Meanwhile, Claire and Charlie struggle to calm her newborn.

episodes.name: Born to Run
episodes.description: Jack suspects foul play when Michael becomes violently ill while building the raft. Meanwhile a secret from Kate's past is revealed, the mysterious hatch is shown to a few of the survivors, and Walt gives Locke a warning.

episodes.name: Exodus: Part 1
episodes.description: The French woman arrives at the camp with a dire warning about a group of survivors known as the Others.

episodes.name: Exodus: Part 2
episodes.description: The castaways on the raft are surprised at sea by something unexpected. Meanwhile, remaining islanders attempt to blow open the hatch, and a visitor to the encampment might be a threat to Claire's infant son.

episodes.name: Exodus: Part 3
episodes.description: A visitor to the encampment could be a threat to Claire's son.

episodes.name: Man of Science, Man of Faith
episodes.description: One of the castaways is chosen to descend into the mysterious hatch, and Shannon stumbles upon a shockingly familiar face in the jungle.

episodes.name: Adrift
episodes.description: Michael and Sawyer fight for their lives on the high seas and discover a new threat. Locke descends into the hatch to find a missing Kate.

episodes.name: Orientation
episodes.description: Jack, Locke and Kate learn more secrets about the hatch. Meanwhile, after being beaten and taken captive, Sawyer, Michael and Jin wonder if their captors are fellow survivors or the dreaded "Others."

episodes.name: Everybody Hates Hugo
episodes.description: Hurley struggles with a task inside the hatch as he flashes back to disturbing memories. Sawyer and the others learn their captors' identities.

episodes.name: ...And Found
episodes.description: Michael goes into the jungle to find Walt, but discovers he's not alone. Sawyer and Jin's captors demand to be taken to their camp.

episodes.name: Abandoned
episodes.description: Sawyer's wound becomes life threatening as he, Michael and Jin make their way across the island with the tail section survivors.

episodes.name: The Other 48 Days
episodes.description: Forty-eight days ago, the tail section of Flight 815 crashes. The survivors struggle to live when some other people on the island continue to kidnap some of them.

episodes.name: Collision
episodes.description: Tempers flare when Ana Lucia and her group stumble upon Sayid and the other castaways.

episodes.name: What Kate Did
episodes.description: Kate's original crime that started her life on the run is revealed. Meanwhile, the survivors lay one of their own to rest, Kate sleeplessly watches over a feverish Sawyer, and Mr. Eko has a surprise for Locke regarding the hatch.

episodes.name: The 23rd Psalm
episodes.description: Claire loses faith in Charlie after Eko questions him about the Virgin Mary statues.

episodes.name: The Hunting Party
episodes.description: Jack, Locke and Sawyer follow Michael who left to look for his son. They meet "the others". More is shown about Jack's back-story.

episodes.name: Fire + Water
episodes.description: When Charlie's dreams lead him to believe Claire's baby's in peril, Locke suspects he may be using drugs again. Charlie's back story reveals a difficult relationship with his brother. Hurley's encouraged to act on his attraction to Libby.

episodes.name: The Long Con
episodes.description: Survivors fear that "The Others" may have returned after someone attempts to kidnap Sun. Sawyer is an amused, highly interested bystander when tension escalates between Jack, Locke, Kate, and Ana Lucia over control of the weapons storage.

episodes.name: One of Them
episodes.description: The mysterious French woman, Danielle Rousseau returns to lead Sayid to a mysterious captive who claims he crashed on the island. Meanwhile, Sawyer recruits Hurley to help him find another island animal that is harassing him: a loud tree frog.

episodes.name: Maternity Leave
episodes.description: When Claire's baby falls ill, she becomes determined to find out what happened to her and tries to regain her memory during her captivity with the Others. Mr. Eko learns about Henry Gale and requests a meeting with him.

episodes.name: The Whole Truth
episodes.description: When Sun finds out she's pregnant, she struggles on whether to tell Jin. Ana Lucia is called in by Locke to interrogate Henry Gale. Ana Lucia, Sayid, and Charlie then set out into the jungle to try and confirm Henry's story.

episodes.name: Lockdown
episodes.description: When the hatch suddenly takes on a life of its own, Locke is trapped and is forced to enlist the help of an unlikely ally. Jack faces off against Sawyer in a series of poker games for supplies. The truth about Henry is revealed.

episodes.name: Dave
episodes.description: Hurley thinks the island is affecting him in a strange way and starts recalling his past in a mental hospital with his friend Dave. Libby offers him support. Henry Gale reveals something to Locke, severely shaking his sense of purpose.

episodes.name: S.O.S.
episodes.description: Rose is opposed to Bernard's plan to build an SOS sign on the beach. Jack and Kate venture into the jungle to propose a trade with the Others.

episodes.name: Two for the Road
episodes.description: Jack and Kate bring an exhausted Michael back to camp, where he gives them news about "The Others". Henry attacks Ana Lucia. Hurley plans a surprise date for Libby.
Mr. Eko enlists Locke's help to find a secret location he believes houses answers to the island's mysteries. Jack has a difficult, but unavoidable decision to make about Libby.

episodes.name: Three Minutes
episodes.description: Michael's whereabouts during his 13 days in captivity in the "Others" camp are detailed. Back in the present, he tries to mount a search party for Walt, but his behavior makes Sayid suspicious.

episodes.name: Live Together, Die Alone: Part 1
episodes.description: After discovering a sailboat just offshore containing Desmond, Jack and Sayid come up with a plan to confront "The Others". Eko and Locke come to blows as Locke makes a potentially cataclysmic decision regarding the "button".

episodes.name: Live Together, Die Alone: Part 2
episodes.description: Jack, Kate, Sawyer, and Hurley are captured by the Others. Michael achieves his goal. Desmond realizes that Locke is wrong about the "button".

episodes.name: A Tale of Two Cities
episodes.description: Jack, Kate and Sawyer are kidnapped by the Others, who reveal themselves as more sophisticated and savvy than anyone guessed.

episodes.name: The Glass Ballerina
episodes.description: Sayid's attempt to rescue Jack, Kate, and Sawyer from the others jeopardizes Sun and Jin's lives. Ben makes Jack an offer which may be too hard to refuse.

episodes.name: Further Instructions
episodes.description: Locke experiences visions of Boone, leading him to a new mystery on the island.

episodes.name: Every Man for Himself
episodes.description: The Others perform a sadistic medical procedure on Sawyer in order to prevent him from causing any more mischief.

episodes.name: The Cost of Living
episodes.description: After Mr. Eko has a vision of his dead brother, he sets out to return to the site of his plane crash.

episodes.name: I Do
episodes.description: Kate desperately tries to protect Sawyer from The Others. Juliet uses her as a pawn on Jack to get him to perform surgery on Ben.

episodes.name: Not in Portland
episodes.description: Sawyer and Kate struggle to escape the island while Jack sabotages Ben's surgery. Juliet's deal with Jack to kill Ben on the operating table is exposed.

episodes.name: Flashes Before Your Eyes
episodes.description: After Desmond saves Claire from drowning, Charlie and Hurley suspect that he can see the future, so they come up with a plan to get some answers out of him.

episodes.name: Stranger in a Strange Land
episodes.description: A power play ensues between Jack and Ben as Juliet's future lies in the balance. Kate and Sawyer deal with the consequences of their escape.

episodes.name: Tricia Tanaka Is Dead
episodes.description: Having returned to camp, Sawyer's help is enlisted by Hugo, who has an obsession with retrieving an old VW van found on the island. More events in Hugo's life are also revealed, showing what brought him to be on the doomed flight.

episodes.name: Enter 77
episodes.description: Sayid, John and Kate find another Dharma station on their way to rescue Jack. In the meantime Sawyer tries to get his stuff back in the camp.

episodes.name: Par Avion
episodes.description: Claire launches a plan to use migratory birds to send a message, but Desmond keeps sabotaging it. Sayid, Locke, and Kate scale The Others' protective perimeter and discover their camp.

episodes.name: The Man from Tallahassee
episodes.description: Jack tells Kate that he has made a deal with The Others; Locke hinders Jack's plan to leave the island.

episodes.name: Exposé
episodes.description: Nikki and Paulo are two more of the castaways with a past just like any of the others. What have they been doing since the plane crash?

episodes.name: Left Behind
episodes.description: With their secret location now compromised, The Others abandon camp and take Locke with them. But they also leave Juliet behind, handcuffed to Kate in the middle of the jungle.

episodes.name: One of Us
episodes.description: Jack takes Juliet back to their camp after being abandoned by The Others. However, nobody else at the camp trusts her or wants her there.

episodes.name: Catch-22
episodes.description: After Desmond has another vision, he convinces Hurley, Jin, and Charlie to follow him into the jungle.

episodes.name: D.O.C.
episodes.description: An unlikely person helps Desmond save the life of the mysterious woman who crashed onto the island, and Juliet helps Sun find out whether she conceived on the island or before the plane crash.

episodes.name: The Brig
episodes.description: Locke needs to prove himself to Ben before he can be accepted into the Others' group and tricks Sawyer into doing his dirty work for him. The secret of the woman who parachuted onto the Island is revealed.

episodes.name: The Man Behind the Curtain
episodes.description: As Ben takes Locke to see Jacob and reveal the island's secrets, Ben's background on the island is exposed--as well as what happened to the Dharma Initiative.

episodes.name: Greatest Hits
episodes.description: Desmond has another vision of Charlie's death, but this time his death ultimately will result in Claire's rescue. Meanwhile, the survivors discover that an attack by the others is even more imminent than originally expected.

episodes.name: Through the Looking Glass: Part 1
episodes.description: Jack and the survivors wait for Charlie to turn off The Others' signal-jamming device, not knowing that he has been captured at the Looking Glass station.

episodes.name: Through the Looking Glass: Part 2
episodes.description: On the island, Jack and the survivors come closer to finding rescue. In the flashback, Jack is shown in Los Angeles, living though a meaningless existence as a drunkard.

episodes.name: The Beginning of the End
episodes.description: Charlie's dying message casts doubt on the intentions of the people that Jack believes to be their rescuers. A power struggle ensues between Jack, who wants to leave the island, and Locke, who thinks that they're supposed to stay.

episodes.name: Confirmed Dead
episodes.description: The surviving members of the supposed "rescue team" are scattered around the island. Once they are located, they reluctantly reveal that they are indeed not there to rescue the Oceanic 815 survivors.

episodes.name: The Economist
episodes.description: Sayid negotiates a deal with Locke to hand over Charlotte from the "rescue team," so that he can get on their helicopter and reach their ship. Kate joins Sayid for the mission, but she decides to stay behind with Sawyer.

episodes.name: Eggtown
episodes.description: Kate goes behind Locke's back to arrange a meeting between Miles and Ben, where Miles offers his terms for not giving Ben up to his colleagues. Locke discovers what she has done and banishes her from his camp.

episodes.name: The Constant
episodes.description: During the helicopter ride to the ship, Desmond's consciousness begins jumping back and forth between present day 2004 and 1996. He is forced to find Daniel Faraday in 1996 in order to get answers and stop the jumps.

episodes.name: The Other Woman
episodes.description: Daniel and Charlotte leave Jack's camp to fulfill their objective, and Jack and Juliet try to track them down before they are successful. Juliet's romantic history on the island with The Others is exposed.

episodes.name: Ji Yeon
episodes.description: Juliet exposes Sun's pre-island affair to Jin so that they won't defect to Locke's camp. Sayid and Desmond meet the ship's captain and discover who is working on the boat.

episodes.name: Meet Kevin Johnson
episodes.description: Michael's journey from escaping the island to working as Ben's spy on Widmore's ship is revealed, as well as his mission. Ben tells Danielle and Alex to leave Locke's camp and go to the island temple, but they are ambushed on the way.

episodes.name: The Shape of Things to Come
episodes.description: The team from the ship attacks Locke's camp looking for Ben, with Alex as a hostage. The doctor from the ship washes up on shore at Jack's camp and Faraday provides some distressing news.

episodes.name: Something Nice Back Home
episodes.description: Juliet is forced to perform an emergency appendectomy on Jack, Jack's post-rescue relationship with Kate is revealed, and Sawyer, Claire, and Aaron head back to Jack's camp with Miles.

episodes.name: Cabin Fever
episodes.description: Locke, Ben, and Hurley continue their search for the cabin so that Locke can talk to Jacob. Back on the boat, Keamy prepares to take off again, this time for an all-out assault on the island.

episodes.name: There's No Place Like Home: Part 1
episodes.description: Ben, Locke, and Hurley go to The Orchid, only to find Keamy and his men already there. Jack and Kate go after the helicopter and come across Sawyer in the jungle. Sayid comes back to the island with a rescue boat and goes after them too.

episodes.name: There's No Place Like Home: Part 2
episodes.description: Ben tries to escape Keamy's custody so that he and Locke can follow through with Jacob's request to move the island. Michael tries to neutralize the explosives on the boat, while the "Oceanic 6" move closer to rescue.

episodes.name: There's No Place Like Home: Part 3
episodes.description: In the season finale, the Oceanic Six find themselves closer to rescue.

episodes.name: Because You Left
episodes.description: As a result of Ben moving the island, the survivors left on the island begin skipping through time. Meanwhile, three years later in Los Angeles, Ben starts convincing the Oceanic 6 to return to the island.

episodes.name: The Lie
episodes.description: While Ben and Jack try to round the Oceanic 6 up, Sayid and Hurley are on the run from the law. Meanwhile, back on the island, the survivors, still skipping through time, come under attack.

episodes.name: Jughead
episodes.description: Desmond returns to Oxford to fulfill Faraday's request to find his mother. Back on the island, the survivors discover that they've run into The Others 50 years in the past, but Richard Alpert is the same age.

episodes.name: The Little Prince
episodes.description: In Los Angeles, Kate tries to find out who is trying to take Aaron away from her. Back on the island, Locke convinces everyone that they have to go to The Orchid.

episodes.name: This Place Is Death
episodes.description: In order to avoid being killed, Ben promises to offer proof to Sun that Jin is still alive. On the island, Jin meets up with the survivors as Locke reaches The Orchid and fulfills his mission.
Eloise explains that the Oceanic 6 have a very limited window to return to the island, and leaves Jack instructions to bring one of his father's items to John Locke.

episodes.name: The Life and Death of Jeremy Bentham
episodes.description: John Locke, now alive again and back on the island after the second plane crash, flashes back to his return to civilization, where he is brought in by Charles Widmore and asked to convince the Oceanic 6 to return to the island.

episodes.name: LaFleur
episodes.description: The survivors left on the island, now led by Sawyer after Locke's departure, find themselves back in the 1970s, where they are now forced to become members of the Dharma Initiative.

episodes.name: Namaste
episodes.description: Jack, Kate and Hurley wind up on the island in 1977, where they meet up with Sawyer and also join the Dharma Initiative. Meanwhile, Sun is stuck on the island in the present with Ben and the other passengers after the plane crash.

episodes.name: He's Our You
episodes.description: Sayid is held as a prisoner by the Dharma Initiative, presumed to be a Hostile. However, during his capture, he believes he has discovered the reason why he's back on the island.

episodes.name: Whatever Happened, Happened
episodes.description: Jack refuses to help save young Ben after Sayid shoots him, so Sawyer and Kate turn to Richard Alpert for help. Meanwhile, what Sawyer said to Kate on the chopper is revealed, as well as what Kate did with Aaron before the flight.

episodes.name: Dead Is Dead
episodes.description: Ben and Locke return to the island, where Ben says he is going to summon the Smoke "monster" and atone for his daughter's death. The falling-out on the island between Ben and Charles Widmore is revealed.

episodes.name: Some Like It Hoth
episodes.description: Miles is chosen by Horace to transport a dead body across the island. During the trip, Miles reveals to Hurley that Dr. Pierre Chang (a.k.a. Dr. Marvin Candle) is his father, whom he resents for leaving him and his mother.

episodes.name: The Variable
episodes.description: Faraday returns to the island and tells Jack that his mother, Eloise Hawking, lied to them--they don't belong on the island. He then initiates a dangerous plan to get them back home.

episodes.name: Follow the Leader
episodes.description: Jack attempts to follow through with Daniel Faraday's plan to detonate the hydrogen bomb after Faraday is killed, Locke instructs Alpert to take him to Jacob, and Sawyer is interrogated about an incriminating surveillance video.

episodes.name: The Incident: Part 1
episodes.description: Jack and Sayid's plan faces resistance from Sawyer, Juliet, and Kate. Locke, Richard, Ben, and The Others reach Jacob at the Foot of the Statue.

episodes.name: The Incident: Part 2
episodes.description: At the site of the ancient statue remains, Locke assigns Ben a difficult task that involves Jacob's fate. Jack is determined to go ahead with Faraday's plan.

episodes.name: LA X: Part 1
episodes.description: Flight 815 is shown successfully landing in Los Angeles with no crash on the island, but the survivors are simultaneously shown still on the island after Juliet detonates the bomb.

episodes.name: LA X: Part 2
episodes.description: The man impersonating John Locke reveals his true intentions.

episodes.name: What Kate Does
episodes.description: Sayid miraculously comes back to life, but his problems have only just begun. Sawyer escapes, and Kate and Jin go after him. Back in Los Angeles, fugitive Kate helps Claire as she goes into labor.

episodes.name: The Substitute
episodes.description: On the island, the being now occupying Locke's body turns to Sawyer and promises to tell him why he's on the island. Back in Los Angeles, Locke loses his job and encounters a number of familiar faces.

episodes.name: Lighthouse
episodes.description: Jacob sends Hurley on a mission across the island, but Jack must accompany him. In Los Angeles, Jack's difficult relationship with his son is revealed. Meanwhile, Jin discovers that Claire thinks the people at the temple stole her son.

episodes.name: Sundown
episodes.description: Claire arrives at the temple and warns the inhabitants that the being inhabiting Locke wants to talk, but Dogen sends Sayid to kill him instead. In Los Angeles, Sayid saves his brother, who is in trouble with a loan shark.

episodes.name: Dr. Linus
episodes.description: Ilana prepares to kill Ben after Miles reveals that Ben killed Jacob. In Los Angeles, Ben contemplates a power play at his high school. Meanwhile, Richard and Jack share their secrets and experiences with Jacob and form an alliance.

episodes.name: Recon
episodes.description: Locke sends Sawyer on a recon mission to the other island, where he runs into Charles Widmore and his submarine crew. In Los Angeles, Sawyer works as a police officer obsessed with finding the conman who destroyed his family.

episodes.name: Ab Aeterno
episodes.description: The mysteries behind Richard Alpert's arrival to the island, his immortality, and his alliance with Jacob are revealed--plus more details about the purpose of the island and the relationship between Jacob and the smoke monster.

episodes.name: The Package
episodes.description: Sun and Jin's search for each other is interrupted when Widmore's crew kidnaps Jin, and Locke heads to the other island to bring him back. In Los Angeles, Jin's job for Sun's father is sidetracked when his money is taken at customs.

episodes.name: Happily Ever After
episodes.description: Charles Widmore brings Desmond back to the island so that he can conduct a dangerous electromagnetic experiment, which sends him back to the alternate reality in Los Angeles, a reality where he has never met Penny.

episodes.name: Everybody Loves Hugo
episodes.description: Michael appears to Hurley and gives him a new mission, and Sayid captures Desmond and sends him to Locke. In Los Angeles, Desmond sets up a meeting between Libby and Hurley to further his assignment.

episodes.name: The Last Recruit
episodes.description: As the battle between Locke and Widmore commences, Sawyer launches his plan to change allegiances. Back in Los Angeles, fate continues to intervene and bring the original survivors together.

episodes.name: The Candidate
episodes.description: With Jack's help, Locke rescues the candidates from Widmore's compound, but their plans for leaving the island are forced to change. In Los Angeles, Jack tries to convince Locke to try an experimental surgery for his paralysis.

episodes.name: Across the Sea
episodes.description: The story of how Jacob and his brother came to the island, their uneasy relationship with their "mother," their eventual falling-out, and revelation of what Jacob was on the island to protect.

episodes.name: What They Died For
episodes.description: Jacob appears to the survivors of the submarine explosion and tells them what they were chosen for. Ben joins forces with Locke, as they both have a final showdown with Charles Widmore.

episodes.name: The End: Part 1
episodes.description: The Man in Black searches for Desmond to achieve his goal of destroying the island. Jack, the newly-appointed "protector" of the island, sets out to stop him. In Los Angeles, the survivors reunite and recall their island experiences.

episodes.name: The End: Part 2
episodes.description: Locke puts his plan into action, which could liberate him from the island.

name: The Sopranos
description: New Jersey mob boss Tony Soprano deals with personal and professional issues in his home and business life that affect his mental state, leading him to seek professional psychiatric counseling.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.description: A mobster passes out at a family barbecue and seeks therapy to understand why.

episodes.name: 46 Long
episodes.description: Tony is getting fed up with his mother. Brendan Filone acts against Tony's wishes. Salvatore and Paulie try to track down A.J.'s teacher's stolen car.

episodes.name: Denial, Anger, Acceptance
episodes.description: Tony encourages an unwanted son-in-law to divorce, Carmela learns another secret of Tony's, Meadow experiments with speed to study for the SATs, and Chris and Brendan find out the price of disrespecting Junior.

episodes.name: Meadowlands
episodes.description: Brendan's death leaves Chris fearing for his life, and Anthony's discovery of what his father really does leaves him confused.

episodes.name: College
episodes.description: While visiting colleges with Meadow, Tony spots a snitch. Carmela, meanwhile, discovers something about Dr. Melfi.

episodes.name: Pax Soprana
episodes.description: Tony tries to balance Junior against the other capos, while Carmela reasserts herself as the woman in Tony's life.

episodes.name: Down Neck
episodes.description: Anthony has disciplinary problems at school, prompting Tony to recount memories of his childhood with Dr. Melfi.

episodes.name: The Legend of Tennessee Moltisanti
episodes.description: The FBI begins closing in on the DiMeo family. Tony and Carmela are angry over all the attention Italians get from the authorities, while Chris fumes that he's not getting enough attention.

episodes.name: Boca
episodes.description: The capos discuss what to do about the local soccer coach, who is to be leaving New Jersey for a new job, while Junior's mouth causes him some embarrassment.

episodes.name: A Hit Is a Hit
episodes.description: Tony tries to branch out into legitimate investments, while Chris and Adriana decide to try their hands at music production.

episodes.name: Nobody Knows Anything
episodes.description: Following the arrest of two of his men, Tony suspects a traitor. Efforts to discover who, however, are stymied.

episodes.name: Isabella
episodes.description: The stress Tony is going through begins to take its toll, and the hit Junior has ordered doesn't help.

episodes.name: I Dream of Jeannie Cusamano
episodes.description: Tony starts cleaning house, while Artie feels torn between keeping the peace in his household, and getting even with Tony for destroying his restaurant.

episodes.name: Guy Walks Into a Psychiatrist's Office
episodes.description: Pussy returns after months in hiding, Chris starts a boiler room stock operation, and Tony's long-lost sister shows up on the doorstep.

episodes.name: Do Not Resuscitate
episodes.description: Junior leaves prison due to ill health and placed under house arrest, while Livia's health also declines. Pussy begins talking with someone interested in learning more about Tony.

episodes.name: Toodle-Fucking-Oo
episodes.description: Richie Aprile gets out after ten years in prison and starts reasserting his authority while unaware of the changes made in the crime family's archetype. Meadow gets in trouble after a party gets out of hand.

episodes.name: Commendatori
episodes.description: Tony, Paulie and Chris travel to Naples to conduct a business deal, while Pussy becomes more stressed over trying to balance his secret lives.

episodes.name: Big Girls Don't Cry
episodes.description: Paulie and Silvio get promoted, Furio gets welcomed, Pussy gets pushed aside, and Chris gets frustrated with his Hollywood aspirations while Janice and Richie become romantically involved much to Tony's disapproval.

episodes.name: The Happy Wanderer
episodes.description: Tony's old school friend digs himself into trouble with his gambling, while Tony's family problems only continue to grow.

episodes.name: D-Girl
episodes.description: Anthony continues to cause problems at home, while Pussy's divided loyalties cause him greater anguish.

episodes.name: Full Leather Jacket
episodes.description: Rebellion by some of the lower soldiers ends in bloodshed, while Carmela starts intimidating her neighbors to help Meadow's chances at Georgetown.

episodes.name: From Where to Eternity
episodes.description: Chris awakens from his coma with a message from the afterlife for Tony and Paulie. Carmela, meanwhile, wants Tony to get a "cut", specifically a vasectomy.

episodes.name: Bust-Out
episodes.description: Tony continues putting the squeeze on David, while Richie discusses the possibility with Junior of removing some competition while 'Big Pussy' Bonpensiero continues to be an informant.

episodes.name: House Arrest
episodes.description: Junior feels the restrictions of his house arrest acutely, while Tony starts putting in hours at his actual job to allay FBI suspicions, while Junior and Richie uses the garbage pick up routes for a double purpose.

episodes.name: The Knight in White Satin Armor
episodes.description: Richie and Janice get engaged, but Richie's violent temper reaches a fever pitch. Tony, meanwhile, breaks up with Irina, much to her dismay.

episodes.name: Funhouse
episodes.description: Tony gets sick from food poisoning and blames Artie's restaurant. Pussy, meanwhile, reaches the end of the line.

episodes.name: Mr. Ruggerio's Neighborhood
episodes.description: The FBI has trouble finding a new informant, so they attempt to bug the Soprano home.

episodes.name: Proshai, Livushka
episodes.description: An unexpected death brings the whole family together one more time, and old tensions resurface while at the funeral.

episodes.name: Fortunate Son
episodes.description: Chris becomes a made man, while Tony experiences another panic attack. Meadow continues to seethe over Tony's treatment of her boyfriend.

episodes.name: Employee of the Month
episodes.description: Dr. Melfi has a personal crisis. Janice has a dispute with Svetlana. Ralphie gets passed over for a promotion and Jackie Jr. gets involved in the family's crime activities.

episodes.name: Another Toothpick
episodes.description: Tony and Carmela try a therapy session together and ends it angrily. Artie, meanwhile, tries to move in on Adriana. Bobby 'Bacala' Sr. comes out of retirement for one last job much to his son's objection after it ends tragically.

episodes.name: University
episodes.description: Noah's and Meadow's relationship is disrupted by her roommate, while Ralphie starts getting rough with one of the strippers from the Bada Bing causing Tony to intervene and questionably violating one of the mafia codes of conduct.

episodes.name: Second Opinion
episodes.description: Junior continues his cancer treatments, but the prognosis is iffy. Chris, meanwhile, finds himself under suspicion from Paulie.

episodes.name: He Is Risen
episodes.description: Tensions rise between Tony and Ralphie until circumstances demand that they resolve their differences. Meadow gets involved with Jackie's son, and ends up in trouble.

episodes.name: The Telltale Moozadell
episodes.description: Tony continues seeing Gloria, another of Dr. Melfi's patients, while Meadow continues seeing Jackie Jr.

episodes.name: To Save Us All from Satan's Power
episodes.description: Tony starts having flashbacks about Pussy's betrayal, and then later discovers that Jackie Jr. has been failing in his responsibilities.

episodes.name: Pine Barrens
episodes.description: While Silvio has the flu, Chris and Paulie run his collections for him, which results in the pair getting lost in the woods and nearly freezing to death while Tony's affair with Gloria goes sour as does Meadow's relationship with Jackie Jr.

episodes.name: Amour Fou
episodes.description: Gloria grows increasingly demanding until Tony realizes who she is, and Jackie Jr. ends up in very serious trouble when Chris realizes who he is.

episodes.name: Army of One
episodes.description: Ralphie issues his final decision on the fate of Jackie Jr., Anthony Jr., faces military school after getting expelled, Paulie and Ralphie have a financial conflict while the FBI assigns Adriana a new "friend."

episodes.name: For All Debts Public and Private
episodes.description: Chris puts a ghost from his past to rest, while Carmela grows uneasy about her future.

episodes.name: No Show
episodes.description: Chris' success earns him some jealousy, Adriana learns the truth about her friend, and Meadow still claims that Jackie Jr.'s death still weighs heavily on her.

episodes.name: Christopher
episodes.description: Columbus Day ignites tensions between Italians and Native Americans, and Bobby receives devastating news about his wife.

episodes.name: The Weight
episodes.description: A joke sparks a series of hit contracts, while Carmela finds herself happier than perhaps she should be that Furio will be around for good.

episodes.name: Pie-o-My
episodes.description: Ralph buys a racehorse, but Tony ends up more attached to it than Ralphie is. Carmela starts trying to invest in her future.

episodes.name: Everybody Hurts
episodes.description: Tony feels depressed over the negative impact he has on people who don't deserve it, while Carmela tries to set up Furio with a friend, AJ is uncomfortable with his girlfriend's wealth, Artie attempts a new business venture.

episodes.name: Watching Too Much Television
episodes.description: Adriana learns that life is not like TV shows, while Tony discovers that a former girlfriend has moved on, along with Ralphie and others they scam the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

episodes.name: Mergers and Acquisitions
episodes.description: Paulie has to take care of some rough relationships for his mother, while Tony's fancy for a fellow horse fancier lands him in trouble with Carmela.

episodes.name: Whoever Did This
episodes.description: Ralph's callous behavior finally steps over the line, while Chris gets deeper into his heroin addiction and Uncle Junior's mental capacity begins to become in question.

episodes.name: The Strong, Silent Type
episodes.description: In the midst of suspicions that he killed Ralph, Tony tries to intervene to get Chris clean and sober.

episodes.name: Calling All Cars
episodes.description: Tony's dreams seem to tell him where his life is headed, but he still feels as though he's out of control.

episodes.name: Eloise
episodes.description: Carmela and Furio grow too close for safety, while Paulie discovers that he's not as big a fish as he thought he was.

episodes.name: Whitecaps
episodes.description: Junior's trial comes to an end, but Tony's trials are just getting underway. Also, the Sopranos almost purchase a house on the beach.

episodes.name: Two Tonys
episodes.description: Some of the old guards are released from prison and want to get back in the action. Chris and Paulie are at each other's throats over matters of money and respect, and Tony decides to tell Dr. Melfi what's really on his mind.

episodes.name: Rat Pack
episodes.description: A passing makes way for fresh wounds, while cousin Tony wants to put his past behind him. Tony Soprano, meanwhile, discovers a traitor.

episodes.name: Where's Johnny?
episodes.description: With Carmine's passing and Feech's arrival, turf wars are breaking out around New Jersey. Junior's mental health, meanwhile, starts to decline.

episodes.name: All Happy Families
episodes.description: Feech makes a pain of himself by trying to return to his past glory. Carmela tries to work with Anthony's teacher to rein in their out-of-control son.

episodes.name: Irregular Around the Margins
episodes.description: A car crash puts Tony and Adriana in a compromising position, and Cousin Tony tries to keep Chris from getting the wrong impression and the wrong information.

episodes.name: Sentimental Education
episodes.description: Carmela has another furtive romance collapse, while Tony B. throws away a chance to turn his life around.

episodes.name: In Camelot
episodes.description: Tony learns about his father through the man's mistress, while Chris' friend learns that there are habits more harmful to your health than heroin. Junior becomes obsessed in attending funerals but that leads to a change in his mood.

episodes.name: Marco Polo
episodes.description: An uncomfortable party leads Tony and Carmela to a partial reconciliation, while cousin Tony gets an offer he decides not to refuse.

episodes.name: Unidentified Black Males
episodes.description: Tony finds out that his cousin wants a bigger share of responsibilities, while Finn makes an embarrassing discovery about Vito.

episodes.name: Cold Cuts
episodes.description: Chris and cousin Tony do some digging to make sure old secrets stay buried, while Janice puts her marriage in jeopardy with her fierce temper.

episodes.name: The Test Dream
episodes.description: Cousin Tony heads off to avenge the death of his good friend, while a dream reveals to Tony what he must do to prevent a full-scale war.

episodes.name: Long Term Parking
episodes.description: Tony makes a request to Johnny Sack on behalf of his cousin, and Adriana makes a request to the FBI, followed by one to Chris.

episodes.name: All Due Respect
episodes.description: Tony realizes that he must take care of family messes himself in order to keep the peace within his own clan.

episodes.name: Members Only
episodes.description: Gene Pontecorvo makes a final break from the mob life, while Junior's paranoid delusions could be the end of Tony.

episodes.name: Join the Club
episodes.description: The family tries to cope with Tony's hospitalization and deteriorating condition, while Tony begins to hallucinate a new life parallel to his own.

episodes.name: Mayham
episodes.description: While the gang begins to turn on itself, Tony finds himself at the threshold, while Christopher gives another try to enter the movie business, however this time as a producer rather than a screenwriter.

episodes.name: The Fleshy Part of the Thigh
episodes.description: Tony goes home and returns to business, perhaps with a new frame of mind. Paulie receives a shock about his mother.

episodes.name: Mr. & Mrs. John Sacrimoni Request
episodes.description: Johnny Sack is granted permission to attend his daughter's wedding. Tony improves his personal security and Vito's secret double life is exposed.

episodes.name: Live Free or Die
episodes.description: Tony hires help from overseas to fulfill a favor he was asked for by Johnny Sack and decides if one of his top earners deserves a second chance as he acknowledges to Dr. Melfi he was given a second chance when he survived his gun shot wound.

episodes.name: Luxury Lounge
episodes.description: Christopher and Carmine travel to Hollywood to take the next step in making their movie but quickly realize they're out of their depth. Artie feuds with Benny after his restaurant falls prey to one of Tony's scams.

episodes.name: Johnny Cakes
episodes.description: Vito considers starting a new life in New Hampshire, while Anthony Jr. looking for a purpose and finds it when he continues his pursuit of revenge against Junior, and Tony meets an attractive real estate agent.

episodes.name: The Ride
episodes.description: Paulie finds public opinion turned against him after an amusement ride accident. Christopher tries to start a new life as a husband and father.

episodes.name: Moe n' Joe
episodes.description: Tony reflects on how growing up with Janice colors his attitudes now, while Vito tries to make a new life for himself in New Hampshire.

episodes.name: Cold Stones
episodes.description: Phil takes out his revenge, while Tony grows frustrated with Anthony Jr's lack of ambition or work ethic.

episodes.name: Kaisha
episodes.description: Tony and Phil begin an explosive conflict that puts Phil in the hospital, while Christopher and Tony both embark on new romances with the same woman.

episodes.name: Soprano Home Movies
episodes.description: Carmela and Tony go away to Bobby's cabin upstate New York for Tony's birthday. Meanwhile A.J. is throwing a party at the Soprano home.

episodes.name: Stage 5
episodes.description: Johnny Sack finds out he only has 3 months to live. Meanwhile, 'Cleaver' premieres and is a hit, while Carmela has mixed emotions about it, saying too much of it is based on Tony.

episodes.name: Remember When
episodes.description: While forced to lay low in Miami, Tony begins to question Paulie's loyalty. Junior and Phil Leotardo both make moves to gain power in their respective territories.

episodes.name: Chasing It
episodes.description: Tony hits an unlucky series of gambling losses, causing tension with both Carmela and Hesh. AJ and Blanca decide to make major changes in their relationship.

episodes.name: Walk Like a Man
episodes.description: Christopher's father-in-law is the unwitting catalyst of a new feud between Christopher and Paulie. AJ struggles with depression.

episodes.name: Kennedy and Heidi
episodes.description: After a tragedy hits the family, Tony gets away from it all when things get too hard to handle.

episodes.name: The Second Coming
episodes.description: Tony fails to reason with Phil as more problems increase with Anthony Jr as his depression worsens.

episodes.name: The Blue Comet
episodes.description: The allegiance of those closest to Tony is put to the test. A case of mistaken identity has serious ramifications.

episodes.name: Made in America
episodes.description: Tony and his family have to stay in hiding until Phil Leotardo is dealt with. His family doesn't like the lifestyle they have been forced to adopt. AJ and Meadow move onto the next step in their lives. Tony confronts Junior one last time.

name: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service
description: Follows the Major Case Response Team (MCRT) from the Naval Criminal Investigative Service (NCIS), as they get to the bottom of criminal cases connected to Navy and Marine Corps personnel.

episodes.name: Yankee White
episodes.description: Aboard Air Force One a Naval officer dies after eating with the Potus, then a Marine officer (connected with AF1) also dies in Georgetown in the same way. Abby identifies the cause, and Gibbs thwarts an attempt to assassinate the PotUS.

episodes.name: Hung Out to Dry
episodes.description: During a training jump a Marine dies when his main chute fails to open, and he fails to pull his reserve chute. Kate joins the NCIS team, and they investigate; they identify not only the murderer and his method but also a drug connection.

episodes.name: Seadog
episodes.description: US Navy commander "Seadog" washes up dead on a North Virginia beach. 2 dead, alleged drug dealers are found nearby. All 3 are shot. NCIS, joined by DEA and FBI, investigate.

episodes.name: The Immortals
episodes.description: A swimmer finds the weighted body of a seaman who has disappeared from a destroyer of the US Navy. The NCIS team investigate; they find a petty officer connected with the victim and the death, and they save the skipper from an explosion.

episodes.name: The Curse
episodes.description: A hunter finds an aircraft cargo pod containing the mummified body of a Naval disbursing officer who disappeared from his aircraft carrier, as did 1.2 million dollars. The NCIS team correct some old mistakes, and now they make things right.

episodes.name: High Seas
episodes.description: A chef finds a naked sailor inside a freezer at a restaurant in Rota, Spain, during a port visit by USS Enterprise; shortly afterward at sea another sailor freaks out on the flight deck; soon one of them dies. Gibbs and his team solve it.

episodes.name: Sub Rosa
episodes.description: Workers find the decomposing body of a man, apparently a submariner, inside a drum of acid. The team treats the case as both a murder and a theft of identity. Gibbs and Kate go aboard a sub at sea, find the bad guy, and save the crew.

episodes.name: Minimum Security
episodes.description: A naturalized petty officer of Egyptian descent dies in the US from massive bleeding due to an intestinal blockage caused by emeralds; he had just arrived from Camp Delta at Gitmo. Gibbs and others investigate at Gitmo and prevent a murder.

episodes.name: Marine Down
episodes.description: Two Marine majors supposedly die during a classified operation in an undisclosed foreign country; one of them purports to call home. The team investigate; they encounter much interference, but they succeed, and they reach a happy ending.

episodes.name: Left for Dead
episodes.description: A young lady emerges from a shallow makeshift grave in Rock Creek Park, Washington, DC; although amnesic she says that there's no time, that there's a bomb aboard a Naval vessel, and that people will die. A passing driver aids her and calls 911; the Metro PD responds, then calls ... Read all

episodes.name: Eye Spy
episodes.description: A Naval officer, a SEAL diver, dies of a stab wound after swimming while testing a classified handheld sonar device, which disappears. An anonymous caller reports the murder. Gibbs and the gang find both the killer and the missing device.

episodes.name: My Other Left Foot
episodes.description: A dumpster diver finds a severed leg, apparently from a Marine, believed to be attached to a live person not more than 24 hours earlier; however, the Marine in question, according to records, died two years previously. The NCIS solves it.

episodes.name: One Shot, One Kill
episodes.description: A Marine recruiter dies in his office from a single shot; Gibbs and the gang investigate; then a second one dies likewise. The Gibbs group expect another murder, so they set a trap, and it works; Tony and FBI agents capture the sniper.

episodes.name: The Good Samaritan
episodes.description: A Navy dentist from a Naval air station dies of a single shot to his back, apparently in an execution-style murder; the NCIS investigates. Two more men from the same Naval air station soon die identically. Gibbs and company figure it out.

episodes.name: Enigma
episodes.description: A Marine colonel disappears during an ambush in Iraq, as does $2M in cash; he re-enters the US under an assumed name; the FBI seeks him, and so does Gibbs, with whom he served while on active duty. Gibbs finds him and figures it out.

episodes.name: Bête Noire
episodes.description: A foreign agent enters the autopsy room via an unconventional method; he then takes captive Ducky, Gerald, and, later, Kate. He demands evidence pertaining to a body in the room. He eventually asks to see Gibbs, who obliges him; he loses.

episodes.name: The Truth Is Out There
episodes.description: The body of a petty officer falls from a ceiling at a nightclub; Gibbs and company investigate; Ducky says that someone dressed the victim after he died. Gibbs finds $40K in cash; he finds the connection between a prank and an inheritance.

episodes.name: UnSEALeD
episodes.description: A prisoner, who was a SEAL and a petty officer, escapes from Fort Leavenworth while serving time for having killed his wife and a cable guy; the team, seeking to determine where he may go next, consider whether his conviction was wrong.

episodes.name: Dead Man Talking
episodes.description: A guard finds the disemboweled body of an NCIS agent in an elevator; the gang investigate. Gibbs feels responsibility. The victim has pursued a cold case involving a theft of $12M+ from the Navy. NCIS finds the thief and the killer.

episodes.name: Missing
episodes.description: A Marine fails to report for duty. He's an EOD tech with a critical qualification, so the NCIS investigates.

episodes.name: Split Decision
episodes.description: Teenagers at play find the body of a Marine impaled on a post; the team investigate. The victim was an armorer at Quantico. Gibbs and the gang solve both the murder and the theft of surplus weapons. An ATF agent takes an unusual part.

episodes.name: A Weak Link
episodes.description: A SEAL lieutenant falls to his death, due to a failed fitting in his gear, while rappelling during an exercise; Gibbs and company investigate; the CIA expresses intense interest. Abby and McGee provide answers, and the team solve the case.

episodes.name: Reveille
episodes.description: With extreme determination Gibbs continues, to the extent of obsession, to concentrate on the unknown terrorist who shot him and escaped. The bad guy reappears, but Kate and Tony disappear temporarily. Gibbs eventually meets his quarry.

episodes.name: See No Evil
episodes.description: A group kidnaps the wife and the young blind daughter of a Navy captain, who, on his computer, receives a demand for $2M. The officer's secretary secretly goes to the NCIS; the Gibbs team find the hostages, kidnapper, cash, and mastermind.

episodes.name: The Good Wives Club
episodes.description: At base housing in Norfolk workers find, inside an underground room, the decomposing body of a young woman petty officer wearing a bridal gown. Gibbs and the gang find both the bad guy and a victim still alive under similar circumstances.

episodes.name: Vanished
episodes.description: A farmer on a tractor sees an unattended intact Marine helo inside a crop circle on his land. While Gibbs and company investigate, a burned-out cabin turns up, as does a charred body. Locals evade, but the team solve both mysteries.

episodes.name: Lt. Jane Doe
episodes.description: A seaman discovers the body of a young woman wearing the dress blues of a naval officer at NAS Norfolk. Gibbs and the gang investigate; Ducky sees a mark on the victim's neck, which he connects to a cold case; the team find two killers.

episodes.name: The Bone Yard
episodes.description: A civilian dies on a Marine bombing range; while investigating, Gibbs finds a second body; other bodies also later appear. The NCIS and the FBI strangely work well together, so their effort produce results.

episodes.name: Terminal Leave
episodes.description: A woman Naval aviator narrowly escapes an explosion of her car on a parking lot; she was a target of terrorist activity due to her official behavior in Afghanistan. The FBI solves the crime, and the NCIS protects the family of the victim.

episodes.name: Call of Silence
episodes.description: A Medal of Honor recipient from WWII turns himself in and confesses to the team the murder of his friend 60 years ago.

episodes.name: Heart Break
episodes.description: While recovering after heart surgery, a commander dies due to an internal flash and the resulting fire without an apparent external cause; the Gibbs team investigate. Abby says it's murder, then she finds a key fact, and the gang solves it.

episodes.name: Forced Entry
episodes.description: The wife of a deployed marine shoots and critically injures a home intruder. During the investigation, the NCIS team discovers all may not be as it seems.

episodes.name: Chained
episodes.description: Tony goes as an undercover inmate to find out the location of Iraqi antiques stolen from a naval base. He stages a breakout with the suspect to find out the location.

episodes.name: Black Water
episodes.description: A two-year-old cold case involving a missing naval officer heats up when a reward-seeking private investigator finds the body. NCIS is on the case, while Kate gets particularly close to the suspect.

episodes.name: Doppelgänger
episodes.description: A coder, officer at the naval hospital, inserts malicious code, creates fake prescriptions and siphons off medicines for the black market. He fakes his own death and vanishes. He is killed and Gibbs investigates the fraud and his killing.

episodes.name: The Meat Puzzle
episodes.description: Ducky faces the "meat puzzle" of concurrently reconstructing three cadavers dissected into many small pieces. Ducky IDs one body, and the gang ID the others and a fourth. Ducky is the fifth target, which causes the NCIS team to act.

episodes.name: Witness
episodes.description: A woman reports the strangulation of a sailor in his dress blues; the Metro PD responds to a 911 call, finds no body, calls the NCIS, and turns over the case. McGee, Gibbs, and the others seek evidence, and they find it and a solution.

episodes.name: Caught on Tape
episodes.description: A Marine sergeant dies while hiking with his wife and his best friend, another sergeant; the gang investigate. Ducky finds a wood-fiber fragment, and Abby reconstructs video footage; Gibbs questions, and the team put it all together.

episodes.name: Pop Life
episodes.description: The body of a woman sailor appears in bed with a bartender, who swears that he went to bed with a different woman. Her death is presumed a suicide apparently from a drug overdose. And then another woman dies.

episodes.name: An Eye for an Eye
episodes.description: A neighbor of a petty officer opens a package from Paraguay containing two human eyeballs mistakenly delivered to the mailbox of the neighbor. Gibbs and company investigate. Kate and Tony make discoveries in Paraguay, then they return.

episodes.name: Bikini Wax
episodes.description: A petty officer enters a bikini contest but fails to appear on stage when introduced; later someone finds her body face-down in a toilet bowl in a women's restroom. Tony enjoys his work; the gang pursue the leads and find the killer.

episodes.name: Conspiracy Theory
episodes.description: A petty officer reports that someone has assaulted her; the NCIS investigates. The victim has a mental illness and has had an affair with a captain under investigation by the FBI; she soon dies by murder. The team figures out everything.

episodes.name: Red Cell
episodes.description: An NROTC midshipman stumbles over the body of another middy at 02:00 on the campus of their university; a third mid has disappeared, and McGee finds his body. Abby helps. Gibbs finds the killer, then Kate and Tony cuff him.

episodes.name: Hometown Hero
episodes.description: A hospital corpsman stows his gear in a self-store room; after 10 months he dies in action in Iraq; then the skeletal remains of a high-school friend turn up in his storeroom. Despite local resistance Gibbs and company solve the mystery.

episodes.name: SWAK
episodes.description: Tony opens a letter, literally SWAK, dispersing a fine white powder; the gang does the drill. Kate and Tony get a free trip to Bethesda. Gibbs and company find both the bad lady and the solution of a two-year-old rape case at the USNA.

episodes.name: Twilight
episodes.description: Tony returns early, in time to rejoin the team in an investigation of a shooting of two Naval aviators. Tony finds a bomb, then it explodes; Gibbs says that someone has again tried to kill the NCIS gang, which loses one of their members.

episodes.name: Kill Ari (Part I)
episodes.description: The gang mourns the death of Kate; they recall her and deal with her death. Ari puts a round into Abby's lab, and the NCIS gets a new director, who shares a history with Gibbs. Ducky accepts an invitation to an unusual meeting. [Con't.]

episodes.name: Kill Ari (Part II)
episodes.description: Ducky meets Ari, Tony follows Ziva, Ari secretly betrays Israel and Mossad, Ziva passes cash and a fake passport to Ari, Gibbs and Jen seek Ari but miss him, Ari finds Gibbs, and Ziva finds them. The gang attend Kate's funeral in Indiana.

episodes.name: Mind Games
episodes.description: Gibbs again questions a condemned serial killer whom he arrested 10 years before. The killer, three days from execution, has offered to reveal the locations of the bodies if he gets to talk with Gibbs. The gang solve that and much more.

episodes.name: Silver War
episodes.description: Ziva returns. A 140-year-old iron casket shows up at the Smithsonian Institution; it contains the body of a UA Marine staff sergeant, so Gibbs and company investigate. The team chases the clues, follow a map, and figure out the story.

episodes.name: Switch
episodes.description: A sailor dies of a gunshot and the resulting car wreck. Gibbs and company investigate; the victim first appears to be an impostor, but Abby shows otherwise. The impostor is another man. The gang figure out the death but not everything.

episodes.name: The Voyeur's Web
episodes.description: Two wives of two deployed enlisted Marines disappear; the NCIS investigates. McGee recalls something, and that gives the team a start. The two wives went into business together online, but it goes out of control. The gang figure it out.

episodes.name: Honor Code
episodes.description: A 6-year-old boy sees who kidnaps his father, a Naval officer who works with a highly classified online-encryption system; the boy calls the NCIS, so Gibbs and the team investigate and eventually solve the crimes and recover the father.

episodes.name: Under Covers
episodes.description: When a married couple, who are also assassins are killed, Tony and Ziva go undercover to find their intended target.

episodes.name: Frame Up
episodes.description: The team investigate a pair of disembodied, unidentifiable legs found at a Marine base.

episodes.name: Probie
episodes.description: When McGee shoots an unarmed undercover cop, the team work to clear his name.

episodes.name: Model Behavior
episodes.description: Three supermodels take part in a reality show at the Marine Corps Base at Quantico; one of them disappears but shows up dead on a fence; the NCIS investigates. The victim's boyfriend shows up dead at a motel. The gang figure out all.

episodes.name: Boxed In
episodes.description: While investigating at a port, Tony and Ziva encounter unexpected criminal activity; they become trapped inside a shipping container. Gibbs and McGee, with the help of Ducky and Abby, find not only their teammates but also the bad guys.

episodes.name: Deception
episodes.description: A woman Naval officer becomes abducted, and she calls NCIS on her cellphone; Gibbs and the gang investigate. She's involved with both a movement of nuclear-fuel rods and an anti-pervert group. The team find her, and they solve the case.

episodes.name: Light Sleeper
episodes.description: Two Korean wives of Marine sergeants die in execution-style shootings; while the NCIS investigates, a third such wife disappears. The team find the wife, then identify the shooter and figure out the shooter and the changes in that person.

episodes.name: Head Case
episodes.description: While busting three Navy enlisted men running an automotive chop shop, Gibbs, Tony, and Ziva find a severed head in a cooler in the trunk of one of the cars. The gang find the rest of the body, the story, the answers, and the bad actors.

episodes.name: Family Secret
episodes.description: An ambulance ignites and explodes after picking up the body said to be that of a Marine lance corporal who died due to a car wreck; Gibbs and company investigate, partly to determine the identity of the body. Gibbs and Jen close the case.

episodes.name: Ravenous
episodes.description: In the Shenandoah National Park a bear eats a part of the body of a murdered Navy petty officer; Gibbs and company investigate. A woman companion has disappeared; the gang deduce her identity. Ziva finds her, and Gibbs nails the killer.

episodes.name: Bait
episodes.description: The team must stop a student, holding six classmates hostage, from detonating a bomb.

episodes.name: Iced
episodes.description: A boy at play on a frozen pond sees the body of a man below the surface. Gibbs and company investigate; they find three more bodies. The first was a Marine; the others were gang members. The team figure it out; Gibbs provides a solution.

episodes.name: Untouchable
episodes.description: A naval cryptologist is found dead shortly before she is scheduled to be interviewed at NCIS about a mole in her department. All signs point to suicide, but the timing seems too coincidental for Gibbs's gut.

episodes.name: Bloodbath
episodes.description: A couple enter a room at a Navy Lodge and find bloody human body parts; the Gibbs team investigate. Gibbs and Ducky agree that the scene was a setup. An imbalanced former boyfriend stalks Abby. The gang chase the clues and figure them out.

episodes.name: Jeopardy
episodes.description: A suspect collapses and dies while in the custody of Ziva; she becomes a suspect rather than an investigator. The team investigate. Then the director disappears, and her driver dies. Ducky clears Ziva, and Gibbs and his gang rescue Jen.

episodes.name: Hiatus (Part I)
episodes.description: Aboard a Turkish-flag ship an explosion occurs, killing one person and leaving Gibbs comatose with burns, abrasions, and a concussion; the team investigate. Eventually Ducky welcomes Gibbs back, but Gibbs does not remember him. [Continued.]

episodes.name: Hiatus (Part II)
episodes.description: Gibbs regains consciousness, but he's lost his memory since 1991. He starts to remember a few things; Jen helps, then an old buddy, then Ziva. Gibbs gets back his memory and a solution, gives a severe warning, becomes ignored, then quits.

episodes.name: Shalom
episodes.description: A bomb explodes as Ziva passes; a Syrian informant and two FBI agents die. The FBI seeks Ziva, who hides and calls Gibbs in Mexico. Gibbs and the NCIS gang band together to help.

episodes.name: Escaped
episodes.description: A former petty officer and federal prisoner, convicted of murder and bank robbery, escapes and contacts Fornell, who, with Gibbs, caught him. Fornell contacts Gibbs, who contacts Jen, who temporarily reinstates Gibbs. The team solve it.

episodes.name: Singled Out
episodes.description: Gibbs returns to remain indefinitely. A bloody, screaming woman (a Navy lieutenant) disappears from the rear of her stolen SUV; Gibbs and company investigate. Abby and Ducky help. The gang find the victim, the bad guys, and their story.

episodes.name: Faking It
episodes.description: A traffic stop, a car crash, a Russian man with a pistol and false ID, a dead Navy chief petty officer, and the bloody letters NCIS all combine to require the attention of Gibbs and company; Franks lends a hand. Together they wrap it up.

episodes.name: Dead and Unburied
episodes.description: While showing a house, a real-estate agent discovers the body of a Marine sitting in the living room.

episodes.name: Witch Hunt
episodes.description: On Halloween the Gibbs team investigate a gunshot wound to a Marine and the kidnapping of his 7-year-old daughter. The kidnapper demands $100K, and the mother disappears. The gang find the mother, the bad guys, the girl, and the answers.

episodes.name: Sandblast
episodes.description: A Marine colonel dies in an explosion when he hits a golf ball at the Army Navy Country Club in Arlington; both the NCIS and the Army CID investigate. The joint team later find a fourth bomb, and Ziva disarms it, but they lose the bad guy.

episodes.name: Once a Hero
episodes.description: At a hotel in Washington, a homeless hero Marine veteran falls to his death, and a maid finds the body of a 14-year-old girl. Gibbs and company investigate; Ducky, Abby, and McGee help, Lee goes undercover, and the team find the bad guys.

episodes.name: Twisted Sister
episodes.description: At 02:30 Tim's little sister, Sarah, shows up at his pad, saying that she thinks that she's killed someone. He investigates alone, until Gibbs and the team are called to investigate the murder of a petty office on Sarah's college campus.

episodes.name: Smoked
episodes.description: While replacing a furnace at Quantico, workers find a smoked body in the chimney; Gibbs and company investigate. Fornell shows interest, saying that the victim was a serial killer. Abby enables Gibbs and Fornell to confront the real killer.

episodes.name: Driven
episodes.description: While testing a robotic driverless SUV, a woman Navy lieutenant becomes trapped inside it, and she dies of carbon-monoxide poisoning; Gibbs and company investigate. McGee suggests murder, Abby has trouble, and the gang find the bad guy.

episodes.name: Suspicion
episodes.description: A woman Marine first lieutenant, born in Kuwait, who has served in intelligence, returns from Iraq and turns up dead in a motel room in a small town; Gibbs and company investigate, with both help and resistance, and find three bad guys.

episodes.name: Sharif Returns
episodes.description: Responding to a call, Gibbs and company find the body of a Marine major in an underground utility vault beneath a street intersection. Abby finds the cause of the death, and Gibbs and the gang find Sharif, the bomber from the golf course.

episodes.name: Blowback
episodes.description: The team must retrieve a top secret computer program, and find the buyer before they disappear.

episodes.name: Friends & Lovers
